ngoList.address: Bhavnagar Blood Bank, Office No. 1,2,3, Pl. No. 1686, B Wing, 1st Floor, Municipal Shopping Center, Sardarnagar, Bhavnagar - 364001
ngoList.title: BHAVNAGAR BLOOD BANK
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: One of the greatest seers of the ancient India and the great Maharshi Shushtrut lays great emphasis on Blood and defines it as Life itself. He has also attributed bodys origin, sustenance and its various facets to Blood. Bhavnagar Blood Ban k is one of the major NGOs in western coast of India. The Blood Bank was established on 4th December, 1983. Bhavnagar has been known for Blood Donation movement since Second World War and Bhavnagar Blood Bank was one of the first scientifically established Blood Bank as per the guidelines framed by Food and Drugs Rules. Our mission is to have safe blood, through voluntary blood donor motivation movement. So far, we have distributed nearly 2,82,597 units of blood. About 1969 Blood Donation Mobile Camps have been organized by us. About - thalassemia children are being taken care by our voluntary Blood Donation movement. We also have blood Component Unit. We have with us dedicated team of people, who are not only committed for the cause of Blood Bank but also for intensive social service inputs. We have acquired a new premises at Sardarnagar Shopping complex at the cost of Rs. 40,000,00 and we need to have Rs.20,000,00 for further infrastructure activities. We appeal to help us to raise R. 50,000,00 for capital expenditure. We are sure that you should generously donate for this noble cause. The donation is exempted under I.T. Act 80-G. Apart form Blood Banking, our Organization is working in the area of HIV / AIDS for general public, migrant workers at Alang Ship Breaking Yard and through adolescent youth education we have covered 66 school for AIDS awareness. We are designated as Regional Blood Bank Center by Gujarat Government and we are supplying blood to Mahuva, Shihor, Dhandhuka, Palitana and Gadhada Taluka.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Biodiversity Research and Conservation Foundation (BRCF) is an NGO in the field of research and conservation of biodiversity and environment that works in various parts of India through its research and educational programmes. Provided to individuals, self-help groups, rural educational schools, colleges, organizations and corporates with its mission of protecting the natural and urban environments and their biodiversity and local communities thriving within them. In last more than four years, BRCF has organized more than dozens of workshops, training programmes, public awareness programmes, research surveys and have participated in several national level conferences. The events and programmes were covered in major newspapers and magazines. As an achievement, Biodiversity Research and Conservation Foundation (BRCF) has received a letter of recommendation from the Hon. Member of Parliament Chh. Udayan Raje Bhonsle Maharaj in Satara district of Maharashtra for the outstanding work at grassroot level in Satara in 2015. Biodiversity Research and Conservation Foundation (BRCF) is also a member and associate partner with Amphibian Survival Alliance (ASA), Texas USA which is an International organization in protecting threatened amphibians globally. More information can be obtained from website www.brcfindia.org

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: With the mission of promoting comprehensive rehabilitation of persons with all categories of disabilities through education, training, employment, community based rehabilitation, integrated education and other innovative means, the organization has emerged the most leading comprehensive NGO in the field. Initiated by a group of blind persons during 1954 as a Recreation Club, it is now a large multi-faceted Agency providing a wide range of services to persons with disabilities. The turning top however came during 1976 when the organization decided to professionalize its services. Today the BPA is one of the largest organizations of its kind in Asia. Apart from a variety of regular activities, its innovative approaches include a state wise community based rehabilitation project, integrated education, services for special need children including those with deafblind, multiple disabilities, cerebral palsy, mental retardation, autism and low vision. It has a developed a variety of products and devices under the auspices of the Science & Technology Mission for Persons with Disabilities. It has also established a language lab for teaching of Braille, media electronic Braille literacy project, limb fitting centre, vision stimulation room, world class recording studio, ultra modern Braille production unit, low vision centre, comprehensive eye care unit, Kutch Comprehensive Rehabilitation Centre for providing services to earthquake affected people, a well equipped resource centre and research & development unit. Encouraged from performance of organization, the National Trust has established the State Nodal Agency Centre; the Rehabilitation Council of India has established as headquarter of the Zonal Advisory Committee (Western Region). It has also been established as Nodal Agency for State level coordination in the disability sector by the Rehabilitation Council of India as well as by the Department of Social Justice & Empowerment for the implementation of State Level Community Based Rehabilitation Programme. The Director of Voluntary Agencies, Govt. of Gujarat, has recognized it as relief organization. It has also applied for renewal of recognitions as a Scientific and Industrial Research Organization by the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research (DSIR); as a training institute by the Rehabilitation Council of India for the training of the teachers and conducting orientation of the PHC Medical Officers, promoting continuing rehabilitation education. It has already received a number of Award for its meritorious performance including Federation of Chamber of Commerce and Industries (FICCI) Award for Outstanding Placement of the Disabled; State Award for the Placement of Persons with Mental Retardation; National Award for Outstanding Performance in the field of Handicapped Welfare; International Golden Award for Community Development Services Overseas from the Help the Aged International It has a very ambitious expansions plan, its forthcoming activities include a well equipped training institute, CBR Project for Persons with Psychiatric Disabilities, and a Day care centre for persons with multiple disabilities. It has also established an eye hospital, an orthopaedic hospital, ENT Hospital, a number of physiotherapy centres and inclusive schools. It has recently introduced early intervention, day care services and residential services for children with multiple disabilities. BPA is thus known for developing and promoting multifarious activities for persons with different disabilities with the target of ensuring comprehensive development of persons with all categories of disabilities.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Artisans are engaged by middle men who give them orders for production. Moreover artisans do not have regular work for more than 10-12 days in a month. As per a preliminary diagnostic study carried out it has been come out that proper handholding support to the artisans as well as production time and productivity is not up to the mark. They are job workers and not working under an umbrella of a cluster resulting in internal competition and lack of negotiation power of an individual artisan with middlemen and other companies. Due to lack of work artisans migrate and are doing wage work many of them are engaged in other work due to lack of continuous employment.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Habitat Forum (INHAF) successfully developed a study and a research methodology based on themes such poor defining poverty line, investment watch, how city delivers its entitlements for poor. We also compiled and printed a book covering six organizations of informal sector workers from Pune in Marathi and English languages. Along with other partners and stakeholders INHAF organized Zopadpatti Punarvasan Parishad in Pune to address issue of rural and urban housing. We gave presentation to Govt of India in addressing its role at Habitat III which is the United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development to take place in Quito, Ecuador, in October 2016. INHAF has taken initiative in developing strategy for Indian Civil Society based on themes and issues which are uncovered in national policies, programs and development actions. INHAF with its partner organization has piloted a project on promotion of bamboo as an alternative construction material for affordable housing for poor Way Forward Chennai is one of our initiatives on strategy development for resilient cities using case study of Chennai for its recent floods.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We are working on the issues like Health, Education, Women empowerment, Self Help Groups, Agriculture and Environment. Especially our focus is to provide equal chances to youth of unorganized sector, women, children and economically deprived community in business, education and health. Encouraging training program for people to develop independent business was organized by organization. We are also joined with activities like natural resources management and agriculture. Our main strength lies in our experienced team thus we can implement our program successfully from grassroots level. During establishment of organization we have started our work in Amreli district to make change in situation of health and education as per founders ideas and vision, later on we have included work of primary education and reproductive and child health activities. We have been discussed to join livelihood program for women after seven years of establishment and started vocational training for women. Organization also included activities of built house for Agariya who are living on peripheral area of sea, renovation of historical places and educational researches. Now as on experience organization started activities of natural resource management, formation of SHGs for self-employment and skill development trainings. We have also joined with capacity building activity of Gram Sanjivani Samiti in Bardoli block of Surat district.
